Ability to provide training and mentorship to team members   on advanced BIM and MEP modelling techniques. Willingness to stay updated on emerging technologies and   industry best practices. Knowledge of designing of MEP System is added advantage.  Excellent organizational, time management and   communication skills as well as the ability to adapt changes.   SPECIAL SKILLS RELEVANT TO JOB (Like Software Expertise):   Advanced proficiency in Autodesk Revit for MEP systems  design    and coordination. Extensive experience with Navisworks for clash detection   and collaboration.  Proficiency in parametric modeling techniques to create   flexible and adaptive MEP models. Familiarity with collaboration platforms such as BIM 360   for cloud-based coordination and information sharing. Experience in setting up and managing collaborative   workflows.   KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY: He should be technically astute with a minimum of 10+ years of   professional experience in commercial or industrial sectors, working as a MEP  Modelling/designing Team Leader, BIM MEP Manager, or similar within Brownfield and Greenfield projects. He should be a highly self-motivated individual who embraces a cooperative   and partnering approach to thrive in our multidisciplinary team environment. He should demonstrate competence in both 2D and 3D systems, showcasing a   profound understanding of models and drawings while applying industry best   practices effectively. He should possess strong problem-solving skills and technical   abilities, along with an impressive attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must for seamless collaboration and   effective conveyance of ideas Moreover, he should be a trusted and dedicated   team player, valuing trust and fostering a spirit of teamwork.

column2: 1. To study the project brief in detail and suggest changes as per the client s requirements in          coordination with the project design and project management teams.          2. To agree on the control philosophy of the HVAC system and prepare a concept document for the      same.          3. To support the project design team in working on area zoning, air heating unit (AHU) zoning,      temperature, and relative humidity (RH) requirements for client approval.          4. To gather data from various departments, namely projects, process, utility, and electrical, for heat      load estimation in the assigned projects.          5. To supervise and analyse the heat load calculation and support the reporting engineers in completing      the task with the required accuracy.          6. To be able to calculate and check the utility calculations required for HVAC.          7. To thoroughly review the heat load calculation, identify any major or minor issues related to client or      project team considerations, and discuss changes as needed.          8. To finalise the heat load calculations for the facility, proceed with HVAC equipment calculations.          9. To support and supervise the equipment calculations based on heat load and space programming      for the project, this might involve equipment like, but not limited to, AHUs, cooling and heating coils,      ducting, dampers, filter boxes, grills, diffusers, risers, etc.          10. To assist in the design of ducting calculations and duct routing drawings.          11. To verify all the calculations of HVAC equipment and load before allowing to proceed for bills of      quantity (BOQ).          12. To support, supervise, and check the BOQ made by the subordinates in detail before sending it for      further approval to the project team and finally to the client.          13. To provide assistance in the preparation of a database of various HVAC equipment, both technically      and commercially.          14. To update the database on a regular basis to reduce the time required for designing          15. To assist in the preparation and approval of equipment technical specifications for further sending to      the project team and client.          16. To prepare the equipment comparative for commercial and technical comparison, place orders with      vendors and explain the same to the purchase team for their further action.          17. To verify the design, BOQ, and equipment list before proceeding for detail engineering, this may      involve checking the heat load calculations again based on actual loads.          18. To supervise, in coordination with the project design team and other departments, the reflected ceiling      plan (RCP) of the project for generating the final drawings.          19. To supervise and approve all the drawings and details received from vendors for all HVAC      components for further manufacturing.          20. To assist and organise the factory acceptance test (FAT) of HVAC equipment on a regular basis with      the HVAC team in coordination with the purchase and project management departments.          21. To supervise, verify, and approve all detail engineering contract drawings to be executed at the site      called the construction drawings release .          22. To assist the purchase team and project management team, where needed, for effective decisionmaking on placing orders for HVAC equipment and site labour contracts with scope details.          23. To attend all the site meetings on a regular basis for all HVAC related work in all projects, identify      possible issues by forecasting, and resolve site issues on a regular basis. This can be related to duct      issues at the site, wrong placements during detail engineering and the release of construction      drawings, sizing issues at the site, etc.          24. To supervise the updating of the design and drawings on a regular basis to keep the design data upto-date as per site conditions and changes.          25. To work in coordination with the documentation, qualification, validation, and commission (DQVC)      team and the HVAC team to organise the documents as per the requirements of the project.          26. To assist the DQVC team in document collection and de-bottlenecking of issues in the process of the      same.          27. To supervise the collection and assist the site team with the creation of as-built drawings and update      the same in the system.          Supervisory and Management:          1. To prepare a work plan and work hour list for all new projects allotted to the HVAC department.          2. To update the plan and work hour list on a regular basis and get the same approved by the project      team and seniors.          3. To work on forecasting and scheduling based on current workload and team strength in terms of      manhours and capability.          4. To guide the management on possible issues related to workload management and technical      capacities and come up with a mitigation plan for the same          5. To assign workload to team members as per project requirements and timelines.          6. To coordinate with the project management department for client queries and the submission of      documents.          7. To check and approve the workload of subordinates and colleagues for accurate submission of      documents required for purchases, client approvals, construction at sites, etc.          8. To control and monitor the work hour report of each team member and take corrective actions based      on the discrepancies found.          9. To improve existing efficiency and productivity in the HVAC team, as well as to reduce the manhour      requirement per document on a regular basis.          10. To solve technical and personal queries of team members as and when required.          11. To maintain amicable working relationships between subordinates and colleagues to have better      productivity at work.          12. To resolve issues and problems as per requirements.          13. To prepare and monitor KRAs for team members and update them on a regular basis.          14. To monitor their own KRA requirements and update them on a regular basis for further discussion      with the RM.          15. To be responsible for identifying the training needs of the HVAC team and creating and updating the      training plan on a regular basis.          16. To ensure that all the department reports are updated on a timely basis.          17. To ensure that all the documents, internal and external, organised in the DMS system are available      as per project requirements and plans.          Skills and Knowledge:          1. Must have worked in the areas of concept, basic, and detail engineering for HVAC with firm industrial      knowledge in this sector.          2. Must be familiar with American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers      (ASHRAE) guidelines for HVAC and International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering (ISPE)      guidelines for cleanroom.          3. Must have exposure in the selection of equipment and systems in HVAC for pharmaceutical projects.          4. Should have exposure to site visits at different stages of projects for monitoring the progress.          5. Should be familiar with the various options that are available in HVAC equipment and systems.          6. Should be able to design the system by themselves, including heat load calculation, HVAC      classification, AHU zoning, duct design and layout, AHU fan and coil selection based on heat load,      and BOQ generation.          7. Should be able to lead his HVAC and cleanroom team.          8. Should be familiar with cleanroom systems and various modular partition systems.          9. Should be familiar in the BOQ estimation of cleanroom systems.          10. Should have industry knowledge of probable vendors of HVAC

column2: Technical Skills: Technical staff typically possess specialized knowledge, skills, and expertise in a particular technical field, such as IT, engineering, software development, or scientific research     Problem Solving: They are often tasked with solving complex technical problems and providing technical solutions to meet the organization's goals     Technology Use: They work with various technologies, tools, software, and equipment relevant to their field     Education and Training: Technical staff may have formal education, certifications, or training that is specific to their technical area of expertise         Roles and Responsibilities:         IT Staff: Technical staff in IT (Information Technology) roles may include system administrators, network engineers, database administrators, software developers, and IT support personnel     They are responsible for managing an organization's technology infrastructure, ensuring data security, and providing technical support     Engineering Staff: Engineers, including electrical, mechanical, civil, and other engineering disciplines, are technical staff responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining systems, structures, or products     Their roles may vary depending on their specific field     Scientific Research: Technical staff in scientific research may include laboratory technicians, research assistants, and research analysts     They support scientists and researchers in conducting experiments, gathering data, and analyzing results     Technical Support: Some technical staff work in technical support roles, helping end-users or customers troubleshoot technical issues with products, software, or services     Technical Writing: Technical writers create documentation, manuals, and guides that explain how to use, maintain, or troubleshoot technical products or systems     Quality Assurance and Testing: Technical staff in quality assurance or testing roles are responsible for verifying the quality and functionality of products, software, or systems through testing and validation processes

column2: Job Description: The MEP Engineer is responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems to ensure they meet project specifications, industry standards, and regulatory requirements. They collaborate with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate MEP systems seamlessly into building designs. Design and Planning: Develop detailed plans and specifications for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems based on project requirements and applicable codes. Coordinate with architects and other engineering disciplines to integrate MEP systems into overall building design. Ensure designs comply with local building codes, regulations, and sustainability standards. Project Management: Oversee the implementation of MEP systems during the construction phase, including procurement, installation, and commissioning. Collaborate with contractors, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure timely delivery and quality installation of MEP systems. Monitor project progress, budgets, and schedules to identify and address any deviations or issues. Technical Support: Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams, contractors, and clients on MEP system design, installation, and maintenance. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, drawings, and documentation related to MEP systems, including record drawings, as-built drawings, and operation manuals. Maintain accurate records of project activities, correspondence, and changes to facilitate project management and future maintenance.

column2: **Job Title: MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing) Manager** **Job Overview:** We are looking for a skilled and experienced MEP Manager to lead our Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing teams. The ideal candidate will oversee the planning, design, and execution of MEP projects, ensuring that they meet quality standards, are completed within budget, and adhere to all relevant regulations. The MEP Manager will play a key role in coordinating activities between various stakeholders, including internal teams, contractors, and consultants. **Responsibilities:** 1. **Project Management:** ???- Oversee the planning, coordination, and execution of MEP projects from conception to completion. ???- Ensure that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. 2. **Team Leadership:** ???- Lead and manage the MEP team, providing guidance and support. ???- Foster collaboration and effective communication among team members. 3. **Design and Planning:** ???- Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to develop MEP plans and specifications. ???- Review and approve designs to ensure they meet project requirements and industry standards. 4. **Quality Assurance:** ???- Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the highest standards in MEP installations. ???- Conduct regular inspections and audits to verify compliance. 5. **Budget and Cost Control:** ???- Develop and manage budgets for MEP projects, monitoring costs and expenses. ???- Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising project quality. 6. **Contract Management:** ???- Negotiate and manage contracts with MEP contractors and consultants. ???- Review and approve change orders and variations. 7. **Regulatory Compliance:** ???- Ensure that all MEP projects comply with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. ???- Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging technologies. 8. **Risk Management:** ???- Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. ???- Address issues and challenges that may arise during project execution. **Qualifications:** - Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Civil Engineering or a related field. - Proven experience in MEP project management, with a minimum of [X] years in a leadership role. - Professional engineering license is a plus. **Additional Requirements:** - Strong leadership and team management skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. - In-depth knowledge of MEP systems, technologies, and best practices. - Proficiency in project management software and tools.

column2: Company profile: Since 2018, innovspatial has provided specialized BIM & Scan-to-BIM services to construction firms, architects, contractors, and surveyors globally. Currently bootstrapped and backed by a strong team with many years of experience in the field. Please visit the website https://innovspatial.com to know more. Job Title: BIM Engineer (BricsCAD for MEP) Experience Level: Maximum 3 Years Job Description: MEP BIM Modeling: Develop detailed 3D models of MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) systems using BricsCAD BIM software. Create accurate representations of MEP components, equipment, and fixtures based on engineering drawings and specifications.         Coordination and Clash Detection: Collaborate with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate MEP systems into coordinated BIM models. Utilize clash detection tools in BricsCAD BIM to identify and resolve clashes between MEP systems and other building elements.         Design Documentation: Generate construction drawings, plans, and schematics for MEP systems from BIM models using BricsCAD drafting tools. Ensure that MEP design documentation is clear, concise, and compliant with project requirements and industry standards.         Quantity Takeoff and Estimation: Extract quantities and perform material takeoffs for MEP components and systems from BIM models to support cost estimation and procurement activities. Prepare reports and schedules detailing quantities of MEP materials, equipment, and fixtures for project planning purposes.         BIM Coordination Meetings: Participate in interdisciplinary coordination meetings to review BIM models and address design coordination issues. Communicate effectively with project team members to coordinate MEP design changes and updates throughout the project lifecycle.         Quality Control and Assurance: Conduct quality checks on MEP BIM models and documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project standards. Implement corrective measures and revisions to resolve errors, discrepancies, and omissions in MEP design deliverables. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Maximum of 3 years of experience working as a BIM Engineer with a focus on MEP modeling using BricsCAD BIM software. Proficiency in BricsCAD BIM and CAD software, with a strong understanding of MEP design principles and practices. Knowledge of building codes, standards, and regulations related to MEP systems design and installation. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks and deadlines. What we offer: A young and buzzing workplace with a flexible, result-based work culture. Competitive base pays with additional incentives for attaining tool or discipline certifications. Access to the Cult and Fitternity Gym network is at a nominal cost. Rewards and gifts on special occasions and recognition for good performance. This is an excellent avenue for career growth, as it offers the opportunity to work in different teams, learn/utilize various skills, and work on various projects. The interview process: While applying, the candidate will upload the CV and supporting documents and also answer all the questions truthfully and after careful thinking. An initial call with the HR department to understand the work experience and see if the employee-company fit is ideal. A discussion with the Hiring Manager to understand in-depth the technical skill set and experience. This will be in parallel with a tool test in our office. On a case-to-case basis, the tool test can be arranged online for genuine reasons for being unable to come to the office. A final discussion with HR personnel and management is needed to finalize the job offer. This can be multiple rounds depending on seniority and other factors.

column2: MEP Engineer is a single -level professional classification responsible for planning and design in the area of Mechanical, Electrical and plumbing (MEP) system including developing policies standard, inspection procedure and evaluation tools for MEP matters along with prepare, review drawing, specification and cost estimates for the mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing.       Working as part of the project management team, reporting to the Project Director, MEP Engineer is responsible for all aspects of the project relating to building services. The role includes the management of the MEP team to ensure that the day to day duties are performed professionally and expeditiously to support the ongoing progress of the project. The MEP team on site consists of the Lead Mechanical (MEP) Engineer, Electrical Engineer, and MEP Inspectors             Responsibilities and Duties               MEP engineer has to review plans and specification according to plan.     MEP Engineer has to manage to oversee the work of subordinate staff contact architects or Engineer.     MEP Engineer has to prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system.     MEP Engineer has to provide technical advice to staff designer, supervisor, inspector and contracting service provider, regarding installation and maintenance of MEP System.     MEP System has to analyze mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing engineering problems and formulate solutions.     MEP Engineer has to identify problems in design, plan, manage and deliver multiple projects.     MEP Engineer has to plan, organize the review and evaluate the work of consultant, contractor, and others. MEP Engineer has to knowledge of MS Office, AutoCAD and Project management software.     MEP Engineer has to prepare and deliver effective oral presentation whenever required.     Advise the Project Director of any technical aspects of the mechanical services that may affect construction progress, e.g. quality or snag.     Continually review the contractor s construction schedule during the progress of site works with regards to MEP services and report to the Project Director on the same.     Manage the day to day work of the MEP team.     In conjunction with the document controller, ensure that the filing/logging of the MEP documentation is undertaken in line with the project handbook and continually monitor the same.     Advise on all issues regarding LEED and ensure that the appropriate documentation and information is provided to the appropriate authorities to obtain the LEED standard required on the project.     Take part in risk workshops and report any risks associated with MEP installations or general project to the Project Director.     Review Contractor s installation method statements.     Review Contractor s shop drawings against the design [tender] drawings for compliance with the design intent and return to Project Director with appropriate comments/approval within the specified contractual period (normally 10 working days).     Review contractor s mechanical shop drawing in conjunction with the structural and electrical engineers to ensure engineering co-ordination and advise the Project Director accordingly.     Where required prepare technical clarifications to the tendered design to suit specific on-site construction and co-ordination issues.     Review Contractor s mechanical services material proposals against specified technical performance requirements and advise the Project Director on the appropriateness of the proposals.     Review Contractor s proposed subcontractor(s) associated with the engineering works from a technical standpoint.     Undertake general project site observation/inspection of the mechanical services works for Contractor s adherence to the approved shop drawings and Consultant s specification, good working practices, and construction schedule.     Monitor and promote health and safety on the site. Record and report any breaches to the Project Manager. If required stop the construction works if unsafe practices are being followed.     Be available to undertake off-site inspections of proposed equipment and materials as may be deemed necessary by the Project Manager.     Undertake a prior review of the Contractor s proposed mechanical system testing commissioning methods and schedule.     Witness on-site piped system pressure test, air conditioning duct leakage testing and other testing that may be required during the first fix works and advise the Project Director accordingly.     On a spot basis, witness mechanical system final testing and commissioning.     Review and comment on Contractor s testing and commissioning results and advise the Project Director accordingly.     Maintain an on-going list of mechanical services defects for contractor s remedial action.     Undertake final project snagging and prepare a list of defects for Contractor s action.     Attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meetings as directed by the project manager.     Prepare draft site/engineer s instructions, relating to the building mechanical services, as required and issue to the Project Manager.     Provide advice to the Project Director in regard to any mechanical services related to variable costs that may be claimed by the Contractor during the course of the works.     Review and comment on the Contractor s Operation and Main.               Qualifications and Skills               Mechanical or Electrical University degree in Engineering     Working knowledge of plans, prints, specifications, and schematics associated with trade     At least 2 years of experience with working knowledge of mechanical, electrical and plumbing     Construction procedures and practices     Computer literate     Possess excellent communication and organizational skills                                                         ?

column2: MODI BUILDERS & INFRASTRUCTURES PVT LTD. is looking for Engineers - MEP to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an MEP Engineer, you will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in various construction projects      Working closely with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders, you will ensure that MEP systems meet building codes, project specifications, and quality standards      The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in MEP engineering, excellent project management skills, and the ability to coordinate multidisciplinary teams effectively        Key Responsibilities:        Design Development:Collaborate with architects and other engineering disciplines to develop MEP design solutions that meet project requirements and objectives      Prepare detailed design drawings, specifications, and calculations for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems      System Installation and Integration:Coordinate the installation and integration of MEP systems with the construction team to ensure compliance with design specifications and building codes      Conduct site inspections and quality assurance checks to verify the proper installation and functionality of MEP systems      Project Management:Manage MEP engineering aspects of construction projects, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation      Monitor project progress and performance to ensure timely completion within budgetary constraints      Code Compliance and Regulation:Stay up-to-date with building codes, regulations, and industry standards related to MEP systems      Ensure that MEP designs and installations comply with relevant codes and regulations      Cost Estimation and Value Engineering:Prepare cost estimates and budgets for MEP systems, including material and labor costs      Identify opportunities for value engineering to optimize costs without compromising quality or functionality      Technical Support and Troubleshooting:Provide technical support and guidance to project teams during the construction and commissioning phases      Troubleshoot technical issues related to MEP systems and implement corrective actions as needed      Client Communication and Relationship Management:Communicate effectively with clients, architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and expectations      Build and maintain strong relationships with clients through proactive communication and responsiveness      Health and Safety Compliance:Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and best practices in the design and installation of MEP systems      Promote a culture of safety awareness and adherence to safety protocols among project teams

Responsibilities: To perform this role successfully, the individual will be responsible for but not limited to the following: Calculation of Water Demand. column2: Having expertise in following major heads of MEP    HVAC system    Electrical engineering    Fire protection system    Installation of cold storage facilities    Installation of utilities like boilers, compressors    Energy Management    Plumbing    Solar  Non Conventional Energy Systems    Water / Waste Water Management    Support For Laisoning  Major Roles & Responsibilities  Head - (MEP) - Position is fully responsible to successfully manage, execute, complete and handover multiple MEP projects related to development of logistic hubs at PAN India level, Institutional buildings, Infrastructure projects, etc.  The term MEP includes HVAC, Plumbing, Drainage, Fire Fighting, Electrical Systems, & wastewater management system The Key responsibility include commitment to ensure timely completion of project within approved budgets on cost, resources without compromising on Quality & Safety. Other responsibility of Project Manager includes: 1. Attending regular meetings ( on work progress, coordination, design, etc. ) with Main Contractor and Consultant to discuss key issues related to the project and take effective corrective actions. 2. Monitoring project budgets and schedule and oversee performance to ensure on time, quality and on budget project execution 3. Coordinate with the design team on all aspects of the design. 4. Prepare periodic reports for management including status of budgets, variance/change claims, schedules, disputes, up-coming activities & safety records. 5. Ensure all technical aspects of the projects are strictly complied with and in conformity with Conditions of Contract, Particular Specifications, General Specifications, Contract Drawings & BOQ. 6. Ensure that the health and safety requirements are provided and that they comply with authorities regulations. 7. Provides guidance, managerial, technical support to complete project team.  8. Analyze drawings, specifications and statements of work in the preparation of activity networks for project resource planning and scheduling. 9. Prepare program master schedule and performs critical path analysis. 10. Prepare plans and schedules, status reports and performance evaluation. 11. Provide program planning capabilities including interfaces and risks analysis. 12. Establish and monitor program and project controls KPI's. 13. Ensure program policies and procedures are implemented accordingly. 14. Develop Action and Recovery plans to support program delivery on time.  15. Design, detailing, installation of solar system  16. Design detailing, Installation of waste water treatment/ management systems  17. To ensure SOP for maintainance of services installed at various locations at PAN India level  18. To ensure proper Waste water, Water, Energy management with proper MIS related to various MEP services  19. Drafting of BOQ / Specifications / Tender documents, inviting bids, preparing comparative statements for negotiation & award of contract  20. Verification & certification of contractors bills with material reconciliation  21. Supervision of the various projects & maintainance activities in progress at various PAN India locations  22. Providing technical, documentation support for various Laisoning activities  23. Ensuring proper SOP for various AMC for the services installed at PAN India level  24. Ensuring safety parameters at all execution fronts with ZERO tolerance  General Roles and Responsibilities    MEP engineer has to review plans and specifications according to the plan.    To manage to oversee the work of subordinate staff contact architects or Engineers.    To prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system.    MEP Engineer has to provide technical advice to staff designer, supervisor, inspector and contracting service provider, regarding installation and maintenance of MEP System.    MEP System has to analyze mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing engineering problems and formulate solutions.    To identify problems in design, plan, manage and deliver multiple projects.    To plan, organize the review and evaluate the work of consultants, contractors, and others. MEP Engineer has to knowledge of MS Office, AutoCAD and Project management software.    To prepare and deliver effective oral presentations whenever required.    Advise the Project Director of any technical aspects of the mechanical services that may affect construction progress, e.g. quality or snag.    Continually review the contractors construction schedule during the progress of the site works with regards to MEP services and report to the Project Director on the same.    Manage the day to day work of the MEP team.    In conjunction with the document controller, ensure that the filing/logging of the MEP documentation is undertaken in line with the project handbook and continually monitor the same.    Advice on all issues regarding LEED and ensure that the appropriate documentation and information is provided to the appropriate authorities to obtain the LEED standard required on the project.    Take part in risk workshops and report any risks associated with MEP installations or general projects to the Project Director.    Review the Contractors installation method statements.    Review Contractors shop drawings against the design [tender] drawings for compliance with the design intent and return to Project Director with appropriate comments/approval within the specified contractual period (normally 10 working days).    Review contractors mechanical shop drawing in conjunction with the structural and electrical engineers to ensure engineering co-ordination and advise the Project Director accordingly.    Where required prepare technical clarifications to the tendered design to suit specific on-site construction and co-ordination issues.    Review Contractors mechanical services material proposals against specified technical performance requirements and advise the Project Director on the appropriateness of the proposals.    Review Contractors proposed subcontractor(s) associated with the engineering works from a technical standpoint.    Undertake general project site observation/inspection of the mechanical services works for Contractors adherence to the approved shop drawings and Consultants specification, good working practices, and construction schedule.    Monitor and promote health and safety on the site. Record and report any breaches to the Project Manager. If required stop the construction works if unsafe practices are being followed.    Be available to undertake off-site inspections of proposed equipment and materials as may be deemed necessary by the Project Manager.    Undertake a prior review of the Contractors proposed mechanical system testing & commissioning methods and schedule  MEP Engineer roles and responsibilities.    Witness on-site piped system pressure test, air conditioning duct leakage testing and another testing that may be required during the first fix works and advise the Project Director accordingly.    On a spot basis, witness mechanical system final testing and commissioning.    Review and comment on the Contractors testing and commissioning results and advice the Project Director accordingly.    Maintain an on-going list of mechanical services defects for the contractors remedial action.    Undertake final project snagging and prepare a list of defects for the Contractors action.    Attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meetings as directed by the project manager.    Prepare draft site/engineers instructions, relating to the building mechanical services, as required and issue to the Project Manager.    Provide advice to the Project Director in regard to any mechanical services related to variable costs that may be claimed by the Contractor during the course of the works.    Review and comment on the Contractors Operation and Maintenance manuals.

column2: An MEP Engineer is a professional designation responsible for  planning and design in the field of Mechanical, Electrical, and plumbing (MEP) practice . They are responsible for  designing, planning, and implementing mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems . This involves  developing policies, standards, inspection procedures, and evaluation tools for MEP concerns . They also  prepare and review drawings, specifications, and cost estimates for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing projects . MEP engineers are responsible for  analyzing plans and performing inspection Interested candidates can share their resume @larika.arora@sgs.com

Ensuring Planning and Scheduling for All projects with a micro level 6 Weeks LAP (Look   Ahead Plan) - Site visit to get the complete idea of the project  -   Coordinating with clients to understand complete details for the project,   Customer expectations and regular Progress Reviews. - Preparation   of Manpower Histogram, Coordination with Contracts team for deployment of   Manpower and Retention of the Labors/Sub contractors (Adequate Productivity,   Workfront availability and Ontime Payments)  - Monitoring   the Project cost and achieving improvement in Project EBIT through Value   Engineering, Execution, PMC cost optimization, etc. -   Ensuring Proper documentation and communication with the client for Claim   Management. - Conducting   Weekly Project Review with Project Managers for Project Progress, Engineering   Status (TDS & Shop Drawings), MIS, Billing plan, Collection, Material   Management, Resource requirement, claims, debits, Amendment/Variation orders,   NT items approvals    -   Follow up with architects, consultants and PMC in case of any technical   issues clarification  -   Material management  Stores & Inventory control -   Coordination with customers and contractors for Handing over of projects - column2: MODI BUILDERS & INFRASTRUCTURES PVT LTD. is looking for Engineers - MEP to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an MEP Engineer, you will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in various construction projects      Working closely with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders, you will ensure that MEP systems meet building codes, project specifications, and quality standards      The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in MEP engineering, excellent project management skills, and the ability to coordinate multidisciplinary teams effectively        Key Responsibilities:        Design Development:Collaborate with architects and other engineering disciplines to develop MEP design solutions that meet project requirements and objectives      Prepare detailed design drawings, specifications, and calculations for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems      System Installation and Integration:Coordinate the installation and integration of MEP systems with the construction team to ensure compliance with design specifications and building codes      Conduct site inspections and quality assurance checks to verify the proper installation and functionality of MEP systems      Project Management:Manage MEP engineering aspects of construction projects, including budgeting, scheduling, and resource allocation      Monitor project progress and performance to ensure timely completion within budgetary constraints      Code Compliance and Regulation:Stay up-to-date with building codes, regulations, and industry standards related to MEP systems      Ensure that MEP designs and installations comply with relevant codes and regulations      Cost Estimation and Value Engineering:Prepare cost estimates and budgets for MEP systems, including material and labor costs      Identify opportunities for value engineering to optimize costs without compromising quality or functionality      Technical Support and Troubleshooting:Provide technical support and guidance to project teams during the construction and commissioning phases      Troubleshoot technical issues related to MEP systems and implement corrective actions as needed      Client Communication and Relationship Management:Communicate effectively with clients, architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and expectations      Build and maintain strong relationships with clients through proactive communication and responsiveness      Health and Safety Compliance:Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and best practices in the design and installation of MEP systems      Promote a culture of safety awareness and adherence to safety protocols among project teams

column2: Company profile: Since 2018, innovspatial has provided specialized BIM & Scan-to-BIM services to construction firms, architects, contractors, and surveyors globally. Currently bootstrapped and backed by a strong team with many years of experience in the field. Please visit the website https://innovspatial.com to know more. Job Title: BIM Engineer (BricsCAD for MEP) Experience Level: Maximum 3 Years Job Description: MEP BIM Modeling: Develop detailed 3D models of MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) systems using BricsCAD BIM software. Create accurate representations of MEP components, equipment, and fixtures based on engineering drawings and specifications.         Coordination and Clash Detection: Collaborate with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate MEP systems into coordinated BIM models. Utilize clash detection tools in BricsCAD BIM to identify and resolve clashes between MEP systems and other building elements.         Design Documentation: Generate construction drawings, plans, and schematics for MEP systems from BIM models using BricsCAD drafting tools. Ensure that MEP design documentation is clear, concise, and compliant with project requirements and industry standards.         Quantity Takeoff and Estimation: Extract quantities and perform material takeoffs for MEP components and systems from BIM models to support cost estimation and procurement activities. Prepare reports and schedules detailing quantities of MEP materials, equipment, and fixtures for project planning purposes.         BIM Coordination Meetings: Participate in interdisciplinary coordination meetings to review BIM models and address design coordination issues. Communicate effectively with project team members to coordinate MEP design changes and updates throughout the project lifecycle.         Quality Control and Assurance: Conduct quality checks on MEP BIM models and documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project standards. Implement corrective measures and revisions to resolve errors, discrepancies, and omissions in MEP design deliverables. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Maximum of 3 years of experience working as a BIM Engineer with a focus on MEP modeling using BricsCAD BIM software. Proficiency in BricsCAD BIM and CAD software, with a strong understanding of MEP design principles and practices. Knowledge of building codes, standards, and regulations related to MEP systems design and installation. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks and deadlines. What we offer: A young and buzzing workplace with a flexible, result-based work culture. Competitive base pays with additional incentives for attaining tool or discipline certifications. Access to the Cult and Fitternity Gym network is at a nominal cost. Rewards and gifts on special occasions and recognition for good performance. This is an excellent avenue for career growth, as it offers the opportunity to work in different teams, learn/utilize various skills, and work on various projects. The interview process: While applying, the candidate will upload the CV and supporting documents and also answer all the questions truthfully and after careful thinking. An initial call with the HR department to understand the work experience and see if the employee-company fit is ideal. A discussion with the Hiring Manager to understand in-depth the technical skill set and experience. This will be in parallel with a tool test in our office. On a case-to-case basis, the tool test can be arranged online for genuine reasons for being unable to come to the office. A final discussion with HR personnel and management is needed to finalize the job offer. This can be multiple rounds depending on seniority and other factors.

column2: MEP Engineer is a single -level professional classification responsible for planning and design in the area of Mechanical, Electrical and plumbing (MEP) system including developing policies standard, inspection procedure and evaluation tools for MEP matters along with prepare, review drawing, specification and cost estimates for the mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing.       Working as part of the project management team, reporting to the Project Director, MEP Engineer is responsible for all aspects of the project relating to building services. The role includes the management of the MEP team to ensure that the day to day duties are performed professionally and expeditiously to support the ongoing progress of the project. The MEP team on site consists of the Lead Mechanical (MEP) Engineer, Electrical Engineer, and MEP Inspectors             Responsibilities and Duties               MEP engineer has to review plans and specification according to plan.     MEP Engineer has to manage to oversee the work of subordinate staff contact architects or Engineer.     MEP Engineer has to prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system.     MEP Engineer has to provide technical advice to staff designer, supervisor, inspector and contracting service provider, regarding installation and maintenance of MEP System.     MEP System has to analyze mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing engineering problems and formulate solutions.     MEP Engineer has to identify problems in design, plan, manage and deliver multiple projects.     MEP Engineer has to plan, organize the review and evaluate the work of consultant, contractor, and others. MEP Engineer has to knowledge of MS Office, AutoCAD and Project management software.     MEP Engineer has to prepare and deliver effective oral presentation whenever required.     Advise the Project Director of any technical aspects of the mechanical services that may affect construction progress, e.g. quality or snag.     Continually review the contractor s construction schedule during the progress of site works with regards to MEP services and report to the Project Director on the same.     Manage the day to day work of the MEP team.     In conjunction with the document controller, ensure that the filing/logging of the MEP documentation is undertaken in line with the project handbook and continually monitor the same.     Advise on all issues regarding LEED and ensure that the appropriate documentation and information is provided to the appropriate authorities to obtain the LEED standard required on the project.     Take part in risk workshops and report any risks associated with MEP installations or general project to the Project Director.     Review Contractor s installation method statements.     Review Contractor s shop drawings against the design [tender] drawings for compliance with the design intent and return to Project Director with appropriate comments/approval within the specified contractual period (normally 10 working days).     Review contractor s mechanical shop drawing in conjunction with the structural and electrical engineers to ensure engineering co-ordination and advise the Project Director accordingly.     Where required prepare technical clarifications to the tendered design to suit specific on-site construction and co-ordination issues.     Review Contractor s mechanical services material proposals against specified technical performance requirements and advise the Project Director on the appropriateness of the proposals.     Review Contractor s proposed subcontractor(s) associated with the engineering works from a technical standpoint.     Undertake general project site observation/inspection of the mechanical services works for Contractor s adherence to the approved shop drawings and Consultant s specification, good working practices, and construction schedule.     Monitor and promote health and safety on the site. Record and report any breaches to the Project Manager. If required stop the construction works if unsafe practices are being followed.     Be available to undertake off-site inspections of proposed equipment and materials as may be deemed necessary by the Project Manager.     Undertake a prior review of the Contractor s proposed mechanical system testing commissioning methods and schedule.     Witness on-site piped system pressure test, air conditioning duct leakage testing and other testing that may be required during the first fix works and advise the Project Director accordingly.     On a spot basis, witness mechanical system final testing and commissioning.     Review and comment on Contractor s testing and commissioning results and advise the Project Director accordingly.     Maintain an on-going list of mechanical services defects for contractor s remedial action.     Undertake final project snagging and prepare a list of defects for Contractor s action.     Attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meetings as directed by the project manager.     Prepare draft site/engineer s instructions, relating to the building mechanical services, as required and issue to the Project Manager.     Provide advice to the Project Director in regard to any mechanical services related to variable costs that may be claimed by the Contractor during the course of the works.     Review and comment on the Contractor s Operation and Main.               Qualifications and Skills               Mechanical or Electrical University degree in Engineering     Working knowledge of plans, prints, specifications, and schematics associated with trade     At least 2 years of experience with working knowledge of mechanical, electrical and plumbing     Construction procedures and practices     Computer literate     Possess excellent communication and organizational skills                                                         ?

column2: Job Description: The MEP Engineer is responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems to ensure they meet project specifications, industry standards, and regulatory requirements. They collaborate with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate MEP systems seamlessly into building designs. Design and Planning: Develop detailed plans and specifications for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems based on project requirements and applicable codes. Coordinate with architects and other engineering disciplines to integrate MEP systems into overall building design. Ensure designs comply with local building codes, regulations, and sustainability standards. Project Management: Oversee the implementation of MEP systems during the construction phase, including procurement, installation, and commissioning. Collaborate with contractors, subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure timely delivery and quality installation of MEP systems. Monitor project progress, budgets, and schedules to identify and address any deviations or issues. Technical Support: Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams, contractors, and clients on MEP system design, installation, and maintenance. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, drawings, and documentation related to MEP systems, including record drawings, as-built drawings, and operation manuals. Maintain accurate records of project activities, correspondence, and changes to facilitate project management and future maintenance.

Monitor an efficient system and record for all project activities and analyze all processes to ensure all work according to quality requirements. Manage all work methods and maintain knowledge on all quality assurance standards and monitor continuous application for all quality assurance processes and recommend corrective actions for all processes. column2: *  Candidates Preferred from group housing projects and must have completed B.Tech/B.E Electrical. Mechanical Systems:  Designing and overseeing the installation of heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems. Selecting and specifying mechanical equipment such as boilers, chillers, pumps, and fans. Ensuring that mechanical systems comply with building codes, standards, and regulations. Collaborating with architects and other engineers to integrate mechanical systems into the overall building design. Electrical Systems:  Designing and overseeing the installation of electrical systems, including power distribution, lighting, and communication systems. Calculating electrical loads and determining the appropriate size and type of electrical equipment. Ensuring compliance with electrical codes and safety standards. Collaborating with architects and other engineers to integrate electrical systems into the building design. Plumbing Systems:  Designing and overseeing the installation of plumbing systems, including water supply, drainage, and fire protection systems. Selecting and specifying plumbing fixtures, pipes, and pumps. Ensuring that plumbing systems comply with local plumbing codes and regulations. Coordinating with architects and other engineers to integrate plumbing systems into the building design. Coordination and Collaboration:  Collaborating with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure the seamless integration of MEP systems with the overall building design. Reviewing and coordinating MEP drawings and specifications. Resolving design conflicts and issues that may arise during construction. Conducting site visits to monitor the progress of MEP installations and address any on-site issues. Cost Estimation and Budgeting:  Estimating the costs associated with MEP systems and components. Developing and managing budgets for MEP components of construction projects. Identifying cost-saving opportunities without compromising the quality and functionality of MEP systems. Quality Control and Assurance:  Implementing quality control measures to ensure that MEP systems meet industry standards and project specifications. Conducting inspections and tests to verify the proper functioning of MEP systems. Addressing any deficiencies or deviations from the design specifications. Project Management:  Managing the MEP aspects of construction projects, including scheduling, resource allocation, and coordination. Communicating regularly with project managers, contractors, and other team members. Monitoring project timelines and deadlines related to MEP installations.

column2: Having expertise in following major heads of MEP    HVAC system    Electrical engineering    Fire protection system    Installation of cold storage facilities    Installation of utilities like boilers, compressors    Energy Management    Plumbing    Solar  Non Conventional Energy Systems    Water / Waste Water Management    Support For Laisoning  Major Roles & Responsibilities  Head - (MEP) - Position is fully responsible to successfully manage, execute, complete and handover multiple MEP projects related to development of logistic hubs at PAN India level, Institutional buildings, Infrastructure projects, etc.  The term MEP includes HVAC, Plumbing, Drainage, Fire Fighting, Electrical Systems, & wastewater management system The Key responsibility include commitment to ensure timely completion of project within approved budgets on cost, resources without compromising on Quality & Safety. Other responsibility of Project Manager includes: 1. Attending regular meetings ( on work progress, coordination, design, etc. ) with Main Contractor and Consultant to discuss key issues related to the project and take effective corrective actions. 2. Monitoring project budgets and schedule and oversee performance to ensure on time, quality and on budget project execution 3. Coordinate with the design team on all aspects of the design. 4. Prepare periodic reports for management including status of budgets, variance/change claims, schedules, disputes, up-coming activities & safety records. 5. Ensure all technical aspects of the projects are strictly complied with and in conformity with Conditions of Contract, Particular Specifications, General Specifications, Contract Drawings & BOQ. 6. Ensure that the health and safety requirements are provided and that they comply with authorities regulations. 7. Provides guidance, managerial, technical support to complete project team.  8. Analyze drawings, specifications and statements of work in the preparation of activity networks for project resource planning and scheduling. 9. Prepare program master schedule and performs critical path analysis. 10. Prepare plans and schedules, status reports and performance evaluation. 11. Provide program planning capabilities including interfaces and risks analysis. 12. Establish and monitor program and project controls KPI's. 13. Ensure program policies and procedures are implemented accordingly. 14. Develop Action and Recovery plans to support program delivery on time.  15. Design, detailing, installation of solar system  16. Design detailing, Installation of waste water treatment/ management systems  17. To ensure SOP for maintainance of services installed at various locations at PAN India level  18. To ensure proper Waste water, Water, Energy management with proper MIS related to various MEP services  19. Drafting of BOQ / Specifications / Tender documents, inviting bids, preparing comparative statements for negotiation & award of contract  20. Verification & certification of contractors bills with material reconciliation  21. Supervision of the various projects & maintainance activities in progress at various PAN India locations  22. Providing technical, documentation support for various Laisoning activities  23. Ensuring proper SOP for various AMC for the services installed at PAN India level  24. Ensuring safety parameters at all execution fronts with ZERO tolerance  General Roles and Responsibilities    MEP engineer has to review plans and specifications according to the plan.    To manage to oversee the work of subordinate staff contact architects or Engineers.    To prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system.    MEP Engineer has to provide technical advice to staff designer, supervisor, inspector and contracting service provider, regarding installation and maintenance of MEP System.    MEP System has to analyze mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing engineering problems and formulate solutions.    To identify problems in design, plan, manage and deliver multiple projects.    To plan, organize the review and evaluate the work of consultants, contractors, and others. MEP Engineer has to knowledge of MS Office, AutoCAD and Project management software.    To prepare and deliver effective oral presentations whenever required.    Advise the Project Director of any technical aspects of the mechanical services that may affect construction progress, e.g. quality or snag.    Continually review the contractors construction schedule during the progress of the site works with regards to MEP services and report to the Project Director on the same.    Manage the day to day work of the MEP team.    In conjunction with the document controller, ensure that the filing/logging of the MEP documentation is undertaken in line with the project handbook and continually monitor the same.    Advice on all issues regarding LEED and ensure that the appropriate documentation and information is provided to the appropriate authorities to obtain the LEED standard required on the project.    Take part in risk workshops and report any risks associated with MEP installations or general projects to the Project Director.    Review the Contractors installation method statements.    Review Contractors shop drawings against the design [tender] drawings for compliance with the design intent and return to Project Director with appropriate comments/approval within the specified contractual period (normally 10 working days).    Review contractors mechanical shop drawing in conjunction with the structural and electrical engineers to ensure engineering co-ordination and advise the Project Director accordingly.    Where required prepare technical clarifications to the tendered design to suit specific on-site construction and co-ordination issues.    Review Contractors mechanical services material proposals against specified technical performance requirements and advise the Project Director on the appropriateness of the proposals.    Review Contractors proposed subcontractor(s) associated with the engineering works from a technical standpoint.    Undertake general project site observation/inspection of the mechanical services works for Contractors adherence to the approved shop drawings and Consultants specification, good working practices, and construction schedule.    Monitor and promote health and safety on the site. Record and report any breaches to the Project Manager. If required stop the construction works if unsafe practices are being followed.    Be available to undertake off-site inspections of proposed equipment and materials as may be deemed necessary by the Project Manager.    Undertake a prior review of the Contractors proposed mechanical system testing & commissioning methods and schedule  MEP Engineer roles and responsibilities.    Witness on-site piped system pressure test, air conditioning duct leakage testing and another testing that may be required during the first fix works and advise the Project Director accordingly.    On a spot basis, witness mechanical system final testing and commissioning.    Review and comment on the Contractors testing and commissioning results and advice the Project Director accordingly.    Maintain an on-going list of mechanical services defects for the contractors remedial action.    Undertake final project snagging and prepare a list of defects for the Contractors action.    Attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meetings as directed by the project manager.    Prepare draft site/engineers instructions, relating to the building mechanical services, as required and issue to the Project Manager.    Provide advice to the Project Director in regard to any mechanical services related to variable costs that may be claimed by the Contractor during the course of the works.    Review and comment on the Contractors Operation and Maintenance manuals.

column2: Company Description   Assotech Limited is one of the leading real estate developers in India, with nearly 33 billion rupees worth of projects under development and execution. With a focus on building "Next Generation Spaces," Assotech aims to create world-class residential, retail, corporate, and hospitality spaces that are accessible to everyone. As an ISO 9001:2008 certified company, Assotech has almost 25 years of experience in the industry and is known for its reliability, high-quality standards, and commitment to ethical business practices. Role Description   This is a full-time on-site role for a GM-MEP(Real Estate) at Assotech Limited located in Bhubaneswar. As the GM-MEP, you will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations and management of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in real estate projects. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensure compliance with safety standards and regulations, and coordinate with vendors and contractors to ensure smooth project execution. Your role will also involve budgeting, cost control, and quality assurance. Qualifications   Proven experience in managing mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in real estate projects Strong knowledge of MEP design, installation, and maintenance Ability to interpret technical drawings, specifications, and codes Excellent project management and organizational skills Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams Experience in budgeting, cost control, and quality assurance Excellent communication and leadership skills Bachelor's degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or a related field Relevant certifications in MEP systems or project management are preferred

column2: 1. To study the project brief in detail and suggest changes as per the client s requirements in          coordination with the project design and project management teams.          2. To agree on the control philosophy of the HVAC system and prepare a concept document for the      same.          3. To support the project design team in working on area zoning, air heating unit (AHU) zoning,      temperature, and relative humidity (RH) requirements for client approval.          4. To gather data from various departments, namely projects, process, utility, and electrical, for heat      load estimation in the assigned projects.          5. To supervise and analyse the heat load calculation and support the reporting engineers in completing      the task with the required accuracy.          6. To be able to calculate and check the utility calculations required for HVAC.          7. To thoroughly review the heat load calculation, identify any major or minor issues related to client or      project team considerations, and discuss changes as needed.          8. To finalise the heat load calculations for the facility, proceed with HVAC equipment calculations.          9. To support and supervise the equipment calculations based on heat load and space programming      for the project, this might involve equipment like, but not limited to, AHUs, cooling and heating coils,      ducting, dampers, filter boxes, grills, diffusers, risers, etc.          10. To assist in the design of ducting calculations and duct routing drawings.          11. To verify all the calculations of HVAC equipment and load before allowing to proceed for bills of      quantity (BOQ).          12. To support, supervise, and check the BOQ made by the subordinates in detail before sending it for      further approval to the project team and finally to the client.          13. To provide assistance in the preparation of a database of various HVAC equipment, both technically      and commercially.          14. To update the database on a regular basis to reduce the time required for designing          15. To assist in the preparation and approval of equipment technical specifications for further sending to      the project team and client.          16. To prepare the equipment comparative for commercial and technical comparison, place orders with      vendors and explain the same to the purchase team for their further action.          17. To verify the design, BOQ, and equipment list before proceeding for detail engineering, this may      involve checking the heat load calculations again based on actual loads.          18. To supervise, in coordination with the project design team and other departments, the reflected ceiling      plan (RCP) of the project for generating the final drawings.          19. To supervise and approve all the drawings and details received from vendors for all HVAC      components for further manufacturing.          20. To assist and organise the factory acceptance test (FAT) of HVAC equipment on a regular basis with      the HVAC team in coordination with the purchase and project management departments.          21. To supervise, verify, and approve all detail engineering contract drawings to be executed at the site      called the construction drawings release .          22. To assist the purchase team and project management team, where needed, for effective decisionmaking on placing orders for HVAC equipment and site labour contracts with scope details.          23. To attend all the site meetings on a regular basis for all HVAC related work in all projects, identify      possible issues by forecasting, and resolve site issues on a regular basis. This can be related to duct      issues at the site, wrong placements during detail engineering and the release of construction      drawings, sizing issues at the site, etc.          24. To supervise the updating of the design and drawings on a regular basis to keep the design data upto-date as per site conditions and changes.          25. To work in coordination with the documentation, qualification, validation, and commission (DQVC)      team and the HVAC team to organise the documents as per the requirements of the project.          26. To assist the DQVC team in document collection and de-bottlenecking of issues in the process of the      same.          27. To supervise the collection and assist the site team with the creation of as-built drawings and update      the same in the system.          Supervisory and Management:          1. To prepare a work plan and work hour list for all new projects allotted to the HVAC department.          2. To update the plan and work hour list on a regular basis and get the same approved by the project      team and seniors.          3. To work on forecasting and scheduling based on current workload and team strength in terms of      manhours and capability.          4. To guide the management on possible issues related to workload management and technical      capacities and come up with a mitigation plan for the same          5. To assign workload to team members as per project requirements and timelines.          6. To coordinate with the project management department for client queries and the submission of      documents.          7. To check and approve the workload of subordinates and colleagues for accurate submission of      documents required for purchases, client approvals, construction at sites, etc.          8. To control and monitor the work hour report of each team member and take corrective actions based      on the discrepancies found.          9. To improve existing efficiency and productivity in the HVAC team, as well as to reduce the manhour      requirement per document on a regular basis.          10. To solve technical and personal queries of team members as and when required.          11. To maintain amicable working relationships between subordinates and colleagues to have better      productivity at work.          12. To resolve issues and problems as per requirements.          13. To prepare and monitor KRAs for team members and update them on a regular basis.          14. To monitor their own KRA requirements and update them on a regular basis for further discussion      with the RM.          15. To be responsible for identifying the training needs of the HVAC team and creating and updating the      training plan on a regular basis.          16. To ensure that all the department reports are updated on a timely basis.          17. To ensure that all the documents, internal and external, organised in the DMS system are available      as per project requirements and plans.          Skills and Knowledge:          1. Must have worked in the areas of concept, basic, and detail engineering for HVAC with firm industrial      knowledge in this sector.          2. Must be familiar with American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers      (ASHRAE) guidelines for HVAC and International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering (ISPE)      guidelines for cleanroom.          3. Must have exposure in the selection of equipment and systems in HVAC for pharmaceutical projects.          4. Should have exposure to site visits at different stages of projects for monitoring the progress.          5. Should be familiar with the various options that are available in HVAC equipment and systems.          6. Should be able to design the system by themselves, including heat load calculation, HVAC      classification, AHU zoning, duct design and layout, AHU fan and coil selection based on heat load,      and BOQ generation.          7. Should be able to lead his HVAC and cleanroom team.          8. Should be familiar with cleanroom systems and various modular partition systems.          9. Should be familiar in the BOQ estimation of cleanroom systems.          10. Should have industry knowledge of probable vendors of HVAC

The ideal candidate will oversee the planning, design, and execution of MEP projects, ensuring that they meet quality standards, are completed within budget, and adhere to all relevant regulations. The MEP Manager will play a key role in coordinating activities between various stakeholders, including internal teams, contractors, and consultants. **Responsibilities:** 1. **Project Management:** ???- Oversee the planning, coordination, and execution of MEP projects from conception to completion. ???- Ensure that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. 2. **Team Leadership:** ???- Lead and manage the MEP team, providing guidance and support. ???- Foster collaboration and effective communication among team members. 3. **Design and Planning:** ???- Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to develop MEP plans and specifications. ???- Review and approve designs to ensure they meet project requirements and industry standards. 4. **Quality Assurance:** ???- Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the highest standards in MEP installations. ???- Conduct regular inspections and audits to verify compliance. 5. **Budget and Cost Control:** ???- Develop and manage budgets for MEP projects, monitoring costs and expenses. ???- Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising project quality. 6. **Contract Management:** ???- Negotiate and manage contracts with MEP contractors and consultants. ???- Review and approve change orders and variations. 7. **Regulatory Compliance:** ???- Ensure that all MEP projects comply with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. ???- Stay updated on industry best practices and emerging technologies. 8. **Risk Management:** ???- Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. ???- Address issues and challenges that may arise during project execution. **Qualifications:** - column2: Roles and Responsibilities     The Fire Alarm and firefighting Designer is responsible for the layout, design and CAD / BIM renderings of life safety alarm systems and related projects.  This role facilitates reviews of initial designs of all levels of complexity to provide value-engineered and code-compliant solutions where required.  Designer also completes detailed calculations to verify system design meets code and standard requirements.  Ultimately, the Designer acts as design lead ensuring projects are compliant, meet all regulations, and remain profitable.  Completes firefighting, fire alarm & life      safety/ protection system drawings utilizing current NFPA and NBC      codes & standards, project specifications, manufacturers      recommendations, and best practices from the industry. Works closely with the Sales      & Estimation, PMs, and Technical staff      to interpret project specifications. Has strong working knowledge      of AutoCAD / BIM Modelling for the purpose      of engineering and application of Firefighting, fire alarm and suppression      systems. Familiarity with several different      types of product lines and related parts. Lead design team,      draftsmans to get delivery of drawings on time.  On time technical inputs to      Project team. Value engineering and cost      optimization of design.  Implementation of new      technologies for fire and life safety system. Expert in Auto-cad, BIM 360 and      other related software??.  Should able to design      independently and deliver all drawings on time. Qualifications 10+ years of advanced fire detection & alarm      and Fire suppression design experience (Active and passive fire and      life safety systems, high-rise buildings,      smoke control, Voice evacuation, etc.) Demonstrated ability in      drafting/CAD, computer skills estimating/pricing. Proficient in reading and understanding      architectural and electrical diagrams. Knowledge of multiple      electronic building systems / Integrated Building      Management Systems (IBMS). Bachelor?? degree in engineering      Electrical/ mechanical (MEP services) from AICTE recognized      college preferred in business or related field of study. Experience in Firefighting      system, Fire Alarm, Security, CCTV, and/or Construction Industry. Solid organizational skills,      including multitasking and time-management. Strong collaboration and      team work skills. Hands on experience with      project management tools. NICET Certification Level      II, or Level I with Level II attainability. Ability to obtain      appropriate licenses required by national, state and local codes.

column2: MEP Head   MEP Head has to identify problems in the design, planning, manage and delivering multiple projects.  MEP Head has to manage to oversee the work of subordinates  MEP Head has to prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system.  MEP Head has to provide technical advice to staff designer, supervisor, and contracting service provider regarding installation and maintenance of MEP System.  MEP System has to analyze mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing Heading problems and formulate solutions.  MEP Head has to plan, organize the review and evaluate the work of consultants, contractors, and others. MEP Head knows MS Office, Autocad  MEP Head has to prepare and deliver effective oral presentations whenever required.  Advise the Project Head of any technical aspects of the mechanical services that may affect construction progress, e.g., quality or snag.  Manage the day-to-day work of the MEP team.
