Review and comment on the Contractors testing and commissioning results and advise the Project Head accordingly.  Attend project, site progress, and any mechanical services-related technical meetings directed by the project manager.  Provide advice to the Project Director regarding any mechanical services related to variable costs that the Contractor may claim during the works.  Review and comment on the Contractors Operation and Maintenance manuals. Ideally from Electric Design Firms or Contracting companies.

column2: We are looking for BIM Manager- MEP Services Role & responsibilities     Acquires and understand the project goals from client, specific documentations, and the kick-off meeting. Collaborate with clients to understand their project vision, goals, and specific BIM requirements. Align BIM strategies with the client's project objectives and overall business goals. Set up the procedure for the control of discipline activities. Contributes to define the discipline list of activities, list of deliverable and time schedule in accordance with client requirements. Quality Checking of model & Drawings in Revit MEP or Navisworks Model before submission to client Ensures the achievement of assigned goals and the fulfilment of the project quality requirement. Lead, motivate, and manage the BIM MEP team, ensuring a positive and collaborative working environment. Provides Technical support to project team. Identify training needs and organize regular sessions to enhance the team's BIM MEP skills. Escalate serious risk to senior management & always have backup plan. Support the employee performance evaluations, establish performance criteria, identify employee strengths & weaknesses, and recommend training & development requirements.   SPECIALIST TECHNICAL SKILLS REQUIRED:   In-depth knowledge of MEP systems and their integration   within BIM. Demonstrated experience in developing BIM models for   complex MEP projects. Ability to provide training and mentorship to team members   on advanced BIM and MEP modelling techniques. Willingness to stay updated on emerging technologies and   industry best practices. Knowledge of designing of MEP System is added advantage.  Excellent organizational, time management and   communication skills as well as the ability to adapt changes.   SPECIAL SKILLS RELEVANT TO JOB (Like Software Expertise):   Advanced proficiency in Autodesk Revit for MEP systems  design    and coordination. Extensive experience with Navisworks for clash detection   and collaboration.  Proficiency in parametric modeling techniques to create   flexible and adaptive MEP models. Familiarity with collaboration platforms such as BIM 360   for cloud-based coordination and information sharing. Experience in setting up and managing collaborative   workflows.   KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY: He should be technically astute with a minimum of 10+ years of   professional experience in commercial or industrial sectors, working as a MEP  Modelling/designing Team Leader, BIM MEP Manager, or similar within Brownfield and Greenfield projects. He should be a highly self-motivated individual who embraces a cooperative   and partnering approach to thrive in our multidisciplinary team environment. He should demonstrate competence in both 2D and 3D systems, showcasing a   profound understanding of models and drawings while applying industry best   practices effectively. He should possess strong problem-solving skills and technical   abilities, along with an impressive attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must for seamless collaboration and   effective conveyance of ideas Moreover, he should be a trusted and dedicated   team player, valuing trust and fostering a spirit of teamwork.
column11: REVIT MEP, Bim, MEP, REVIT, Sketchup, Building, MEP Coordination, HVAC, BIM 360, Commercial Buildings

column2: Technical Skills: Technical staff typically possess specialized knowledge, skills, and expertise in a particular technical field, such as IT, engineering, software development, or scientific research     Problem Solving: They are often tasked with solving complex technical problems and providing technical solutions to meet the organization's goals     Technology Use: They work with various technologies, tools, software, and equipment relevant to their field     Education and Training: Technical staff may have formal education, certifications, or training that is specific to their technical area of expertise         Roles and Responsibilities:         IT Staff: Technical staff in IT (Information Technology) roles may include system administrators, network engineers, database administrators, software developers, and IT support personnel     They are responsible for managing an organization's technology infrastructure, ensuring data security, and providing technical support     Engineering Staff: Engineers, including electrical, mechanical, civil, and other engineering disciplines, are technical staff responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining systems, structures, or products     Their roles may vary depending on their specific field     Scientific Research: Technical staff in scientific research may include laboratory technicians, research assistants, and research analysts     They support scientists and researchers in conducting experiments, gathering data, and analyzing results     Technical Support: Some technical staff work in technical support roles, helping end-users or customers troubleshoot technical issues with products, software, or services     Technical Writing: Technical writers create documentation, manuals, and guides that explain how to use, maintain, or troubleshoot technical products or systems     Quality Assurance and Testing: Technical staff in quality assurance or testing roles are responsible for verifying the quality and functionality of products, software, or systems through testing and validation processes
column11: Manager Quality Assurance, Technical writing, data security, IT support, Technical Staff, Information technology, Technical support, Software engineering, IT Staff

column2: We are seeking a proficient BIM Modeler specializing in Electrical systems, with at least 2+ years of industry experience, for our operations in Chennai     The ideal candidate should excel at creating and managing sophisticated electrical BIM models, ensuring compliance with the specific standards and requirements of the region             Responsibilities          Design, develop, and manage complex electrical BIM models in line with project specifications and Chennais industry standards.         Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other BIM specialists to ensure that electrical models are integrated seamlessly within multidisciplinary BIM projects.         Attend coordination meetings, representing the electrical BIM perspective, and work to resolve any model clashes or integration challenges.         Continuously review and update electrical BIM models to reflect design changes or site adaptations.         Assist in the creation of fabrication and installation drawings from BIM models.         Stay informed about the latest advancements in BIM technologies, tools, and practices.         Qualifications          Relevant degree or diploma in Electrical Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field with a focus on BIM.         A minimum of 2+ years of hands-on experience in electrical BIM modelling, specifically in the Chennai market.         Proficiency in key BIM software applications, such as Autodesk Revit MEP, Navisworks, and other relevant platforms.         Comprehensive understanding of electrical systems, standards, and best practices in BIM modelling.         Strong communication skills, in both English and Tamil, to facilitate effective collaboration with diverse teams and stakeholders.         A detail-oriented approach, ensuring precision and accuracy in all electrical BIM models created.         Ability to adapt and grow with evolving project requirements and technologies, demonstrating flexibility and resilience

column2: Role & responsibilities   Proactively manage and administer the delivery of the Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing and Fire protection works undertaken by package sub-contractors, in terms of Time, Cost and Quality.  Milestones including, planning, engineering, construction, commissioning and handover under limited supervision.  Mitigate risk by anticipation problems that can arise and provide resolution in a proactive manner by interfacing with other cells of the Construction Management Team    Key Responsibilities Planning   and Initiation: To interface with a multi discipline project team, to   advise the team and fully integrate and coordinate the MEP works into the   overall construction process. To manage and lead the MEP works acting as the facilitator   between the site project team and the subcontracted works  Understand the design intent and suggest the design team   in case of improvements prior to BOQ attachment and tender initiation Establish the work flow sequence of the package in   coordination with other departments (CM, Finishing, etc.) by planning the   activities with respect to the Overall Project Time schedule and ensure   quality and progress as per the timelines. Prepare execution strategy for the project by   understanding requirements of all stakeholders  Prepare and monitor risk assessment register regularly for   the project  Prepare Manpower and P & E deployment schedule Ensure that the sub contract works are constructed in   accordance with the contract documents including drawings and specifications. Evaluate the performance of  contractors on a periodic basis  Monitor SR/PR   trackers weekly and ensure timely approvals of vendors and materials in   coordination with Procurement (include inputs from HOC, if required).  Oversee all MEP works are executed as per the actual   contractual terms and as per the correct sequence/ VFC drawings ensuring no   deviations. Monitor the process   of sign-off to FM team and complete handover with all the documents, reports,   testing as well as quantification of extra material for maintenance. column2: Roles and Responsibilities   Summary: Hands on experience on complete Data Center Design Cycle and all the building blocks of Data Center like; Electrical, Mechanical, Safety & Security, Building Automation, Networking, telco etc.         Responsibilities: The candidate is expected to play the below said role in the organization: Act as Single Point of Contact and responsible for the technical aspect of the Data Center and will support Project Manager/Director   Data Center MEP designs and collaboration with other disciplines to create a construction document.   Critical Data Center equipment design including Generators, Uninterruptible Power Supplies, Switchgear, Transformers, Earthing, HVAC, Chiller's system, and Fire Detection/Suppression systems   Design and collaborate with other disciplines to create a construction document set.   Work with Consultants/vendors and manufacturers to specify the appropriate electrical equipment.   Work with utilities to understand and define site utility requirements.   Review and approval of equipment submissions.   Work with commissioning teams to properly test and validate the installation, operation, and performance of electrical systems.   Prepare and validate technical Pre-qualifications, Requests for Proposals (RFP's), and requests for Quotations (RFQs) for projects.   Work with internal teams to understand the requirements.   Perform site review, work with onsite field engineers, and provide engineering evaluations, electrical systems audits, and start-up as needed.   Coordination with PMC, Site Engineers, field personnel, and project management team, delivering projects efficiently by proposing effective solutions to problems encountered.   Preparation and dissemination of dashboard and reports from a Design Consultancy perspective   Ensure completion of Project documentation from a technical perspective.  Education: Bachelor?? degree in Electrical/Mechanical engineering.   Certification in PMP or Prince or equivalent is preferred Data Centre Certification ATD / CDCP Preferred.      Experience: Minimum 10+ years of experience in data Center Technologies.   Degree in Electrical engineering or relevant discipline.   Experience with design/build projects and or multiple significant upgrade projects.   Fundamental knowledge of network design and layout.   Knowledge of building codes and regulations and safety standards   Knowledge of high voltage substations, mission critical power distribution and generator power systems   Knowledge in Datacentre terminologies and guidelines such as TIA942 and UPTIME standard.   Knowledge of MV, RMUs, TRF, Genset, ATS, UPS, Rectifiers, Busway, Pathways, PDUs, Earthing, CHW, DX, IEC, PAHU, Fire Protection, Thermal/Fuel/Septic Tanks, Pumps, Manholes/Handholes, and Duct bank.   Candidates having relevant experience of Construction Management of Data Center / IT / ITes / Commercial will be preferred Candidates having working knowledge of project monitoring software such as MS Office / Primavera will be preferred. Knowledge: Hands on experience on complete Data Center Design Cycle and all the building blocks of Data Center like; Architectural, Civil, Structural, Electrical, Mechanical, Safety & Security, Building Automation, Networking, telco etc.  Skills: In-depth understanding of critical Data Center electrical and mechanical equipment. Experience reading and interpreting design, equipment and construction specifications and drawings.   Be a motivated, highly dependable individual and problem-solving skills.   Ability to research new designs, technologies, and construction methods of data centre equipment and facilities.   An ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality and reliability.   Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards.   The ability to perform complex business case analysis to justify technical decisions and present the justification to management in a high-level review. Knowledge of required norms of statutory compliance

column2: Role   MEP ENGINEERS [Construction-based experience] We are seeking a skilled MEP Engineer to join our construction team. As an MEP Engineer, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, design, coordination, and implementation of MEP systems to ensure they meet project requirements and comply with relevant regulations and standards. Tech / B. E Civil Engineering Experience: 5+ years of experience Salary: Minimum 40K to Maximum 75K Eligible candidates contact HR immediately  & responsibilities   Perks and benefits   Yearly bonus + Performance bonus

column2: Job Title: Lead - Infrastructure Location: Mumbai Purpose We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Lead  Infrastructure (Services and Utilities) to join our team in Mumbai. The ideal candidate will have 15-20 years of experience in the Real Estate and Construction industry. As the Lead Infrastructure , you will be responsible for overseeing the successful execution and planning of Infrastructure (services and utilities) and design projects. If you are a dynamic leader with a proven track record in Infrastructure, services and utilities execution and have a passion for driving excellence, we encourage you to apply. Experience 15-20 years of experience in the Real Estate and Construction industry, specifically in Infrastructure (services and utilities) and design and building.  Roles and Responsibilities Oversee the management of all utilities and services infrastructure, including electricity, water,HVAC systems and analysis and design of sewage systems. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, architects, engineers and consultants to integrate utilities and services infrastructure seamlessly into project designs. Develop innovative solutions for optimizing utility consumption, energy efficiency and sustainability.  Manage implementation of utilities and services infrastructure systems to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Conduct regular inspections and audits of infrastructure systems to identify areas for improvement and optimization. Coordinate with regulatory authorities to ensure compliance with local building codes, safety regulations and environmental standards. Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams on utilities and services infrastructure design and implementation. Develop detailed final designs for water Transmission main for raw & clear water supply system, including all required drawings and reports Study, review & approval of design & drawings     Education Qualification B. Tech preferably with M.Tech Certification Required Professional certifications in Infrastructure (services and utilities) and design or relevant field would be advantageous. Behavioral Skills Strong leadership and team management abilities Achievement oriented  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Proven problem-solving and decision-making capabilities Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment Demonstrated strategic thinking and planning skills High on integrity Time Management Skills Self-development/Self learning Technical Skills Expertise in analysis & design of Intake works, River Weir, Raw Water & Clear Water transmission main, Booster Pumping Main & distribution system, service reservoirs, Intake Pumping Station, Clear Water Pumping Station, and Booster Pumping Station Expertise in Analysis & Design of Sewage collection system & sewage Pumping systems, as well as stormwater drainage systems,   Expertise in Analysis & Design of Buildings Internal cold & hot water supply & internal sanitary drainage systems, roof rainwater drainage systems   Pump Head Calculations & Preparation of GA Drawings for Pumping Stations Preparation of GA Drawings for GSRs & ESRs. ??Review of GA Drawings for Non-Process Buildings Software Expertise in Water GEMS V8i, Sewer GEMS V8i,Auto CAD Expertise in Design of Storm Network Designing of ELV system which includes fire alarm system, Telephone & Data System, CCTV System, Access control System as per the requirement Review of Civil & Structural Drawings w.r.t GA Drawings  Review of Electromechanical Drawings w.r.t project requirements Hydraulic Design of Sewage collection system & Pumping Mains Review of Sewage treatment plants of various technologies. Non-Negotiable Skills Infrastructure Expertise in Softwares related to design,electrical,water and other infrastructure. Resource management  Design Leadership Conclusion The Lead - Infrastructure role at Adani offers an exciting opportunity to lead and drive Infrastructure (services and utilities) excellence in the dynamic real estate and construction industry. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where employees are empowered to innovate and grow. If you are passionate about making a significant impact and possess the required skills and experience, we encourage you to apply and be part of our talented team at Adani.

column1: MEP Site Engineer (Electrical, HVAC, Fire, Plumbing)
column2: Greetings from Super touch Interiors ! Dear Candidates, We  are excited to announce an opportunity to join our team as an MEP  Engineer with a focus on Mechanical, Electrical, HVAC & Plumbing. If you have  substantial experience in residential & commercial construction and are passionate  about delivering high-quality building solutions, we want to hear from  you! Role & responsibilities     Design and Planning Conceptual Design: Develop initial design concepts for MEP systems based on project requirements. Collaborate with architects and other engineers to integrate MEP systems seamlessly into building design. Detailed Design: Create detailed plans, specifications, and layouts for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. Use software tools like AutoCAD, Revit MEP, and other design software to produce detailed drawings and models. Load Calculations: Perform calculations for heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) loads. Determine electrical load requirements and plumbing demands. Code Compliance: Ensure that designs comply with local building codes, regulations, and industry standards. Stay updated on changes in codes and standards. Project Management Coordination: Coordinate with project managers, architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders. Ensure that MEP systems are well-integrated with other building components. Scheduling: Develop project schedules for MEP installations. Monitor progress to ensure timely completion of MEP-related tasks. Budgeting: Estimate costs for MEP systems. Manage the MEP budget and work to minimize costs while maintaining quality. Construction and Installation Supervision: Oversee the installation of MEP systems on-site. Ensure that installations are performed according to design specifications and standards. Quality Control: Conduct inspections and quality control checks during installation. Address any issues or deviations from the design. Testing and Commissioning: Test MEP systems to ensure they are functioning correctly. Commission systems and verify they meet performance criteria. Maintenance and Troubleshooting Operational Support: Provide support for the operation and maintenance of MEP systems post-construction. Develop maintenance schedules and procedures. Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve issues with MEP systems. Implement corrective actions and repairs as needed. Documentation and Reporting Documentation: Maintain detailed records of design calculations, installation procedures, and testing results. Prepare operation manuals and maintenance guides. Reporting: Provide regular updates and reports to project stakeholders. Document any changes or modifications made during the project lifecycle. Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: An MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) engineer is responsible for designing, planning, and managing the MEP systems of buildings and infrastructure projects. Their role is crucial for ensuring the functionality, safety, and efficiency of a building's systems. Here is a detailed job description for an MEP engineer: Job Title: MEP Engineer Job Summary: The MEP Engineer will be responsible for the design, installation, and maintenance of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in various construction projects. This role requires close collaboration with architects, contractors, and other engineers to ensure systems are integrated seamlessly and meet all safety and regulatory standards. Key Responsibilities: Design and Planning: Develop detailed designs for mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. Create system layouts, schematics, and detailed drawings using CAD software. Coordinate with architects and other engineers to integrate MEP systems into overall building design. Conduct feasibility studies and technical reports. Project Management: Oversee the installation of MEP systems during the construction phase. Manage project timelines, ensuring MEP installations are completed on schedule. Coordinate with subcontractors and manage on-site MEP teams. Ensure compliance with project specifications, building codes, and safety standards. Technical Support: Provide technical guidance and support during the construction phase. Troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to MEP systems. Conduct system testing and commissioning to ensure proper functionality. Develop and oversee maintenance plans for MEP systems post-construction. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all designs and installations comply with relevant codes, standards, and regulations. Prepare documentation and reports for regulatory approvals and inspections. Cost Management: Prepare cost estimates and budgets for MEP systems. Monitor project costs and work to optimize efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Assist in procurement of MEP equipment and materials. Sustainability and Innovation: Implement sustainable design practices to enhance energy efficiency and environmental performance. Stay updated with the latest technologies and advancements in MEP systems. Propose innovative solutions to improve system performance and sustainability. Required Qualifications: Education:  Bachelors degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Civil Engineering. Experience:  Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in MEP engineering or a related field. Skills: Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit). Strong understanding of building codes and standards. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
column11: Plumbing, Mechanical, MEP, Electricals

column2: Job Summary: The MEP Engineer for High-Rise Residential projects is responsible for the coordination, and installation of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in high-rise residential buildings. They play a critical role in ensuring that these systems are designed and implemented efficiently, safely, and in compliance with relevant Drawings. This role requires strong technical expertise in MEP systems and coordination with other engineering disciplines. Job Description 1. Supervise and coordinate the work of electrical, plumbing and irrigation systems, Fire and FAPA system and HVAC and basement ventilation in high-rise residential buildings, ensuring compliance with relevant drawings, 2. Coordinate MEP designs with architectural and structural plans to ensure integration and compatibility with the overall building designs, 3. Oversee the installation and testing of MEP systems, ensuring that work is carried out according to design specifications, 4. Collaborate with civil project team members, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the project to ensure efficient project execution. 5. Maintain project documentation, including drawings, reports, and correspondence. Prepare regular progress reports for senior management. 6. Maintain project schedules, coordinate with subcontractors and suppliers, and ensure that work is completed on time. 7. Conduct daily briefing with site team leaders to follow-up and report on the work progress in order to anticipate any possible delays with regards to planned tasks. 8. Conduct regular inspections and assess the work performance done by all subcontractors. 9. Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them, ensuring that projects are completed safely withing given schedule. Qualification and Skills. 10. Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field. Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., PE license) may be preferred. 11. Proven experience in MEP design and construction, with a minimum of  1-6  years in high-rise residential projects. 12. Strong technical knowledge of MEP systems and building codes.

column2: *5.5 Days working* 2-4 years of experience in BIM(MEP). Ensure high level of accuracy of work done and meet deadlines. Create 3D views on an as-needed basis for marketing or project use Degree/Diploma in Mechanical. Summary: A BIM Modeler specializing in MEP systems plays a critical role in the design and construction process, ensuring that the mechanical, electrical, and plumbing components of a building are well- coordinated and meet the necessary standards and regulations. We are looking a candidate who has experience to handle International projects and 3D BIM Coordinated models. If you are a passionate individual looking to execute, to innovate, and you are ready to enable business to grow for the future, then this is the place for you to thrive! Primary Responsibilities: MEP Modelling: Creating detailed 3D models of Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing systems using BIM software. This includes components such as HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning), electrical wiring, plumbing, and fire protection systems. System Integration: Collaborating with architects, structural engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate MEP systems seamlessly into the overall building design. Ensuring that the MEP systems align with the architectural and structural elements. Coordination: Conducting clash detection and coordination meetings to identify and resolve clashes or conflicts between different building systems. This is crucial to prevent issues during construction and to optimize spatial efficiency. Parametric Modeling: Creating parametric models that allow for the dynamic adjustment of system components. This helps in exploring different design options and facilitates easy updates as the project evolves. Data Management: Adding and managing relevant data associated with MEP components, such as specifications, performance data, and maintenance requirements. This information is valuable for facility management and maintenance activities. Performance Analysis: Utilizing BIM tools to analyze the performance of MEP systems, such as energy efficiency, thermal comfort, and lighting levels. This contributes to the overall sustainability and functionality of the building. Code Compliance: Ensuring that MEP systems comply with local building codes and regulations. Staying informed about industry standards and updates to ensure designs meet safety and compliance requirements. Documentation: Generating detailed drawings, schedules, and reports related to MEP systems. Providing documentation for construction teams, facility managers, and other stakeholders. Technical Skills: Create 3D BIM coordinated models in Revit MEP as per specific standards and practices. Develop plans, sections, elevations and details from a 3D BIM model for projects of all sizes and technical complexities. Business acumen Higher cognitive and analytical skills Excellent communication skills and presentability.
column11: AutoCAD, Revit

column2: Role & responsibilities   Carryout MEP Design project execution & execute the services assigned as per the client requirements & timelines. Manage day-to-day project matters related to the design services support thats required to be extended to design team & site project team. It is required to be stationed at site for a duration of construction & execute following responsibilities:  1. Understand the design & extend support necessary in terms of gathering inputs from client & site team to aid design works for the project.  2. Support in preparation of technical specifications, data sheets, schedules, material take off & BOQ for all above.  3. Understand & be familiar with Sizing of support systems for all above etc.  4. Understanding of Design standards & local codes.  5. Have a understanding on Load analysis for structural loading or slab strengthening as well as other critical aspects of the project which would be impacting planning, design & construction works.  6. Have an understanding on Head load / Electrical load list indicating critical loads, MD calculations and single line diagrams / HVAC schematics.  7. Support in preparation of DBR & Concept design reports for MEP Systems.  8. Review & understand design drawings BOQs GFC Specifications etc as prepared by the internal design team. Provide inputs for design team. Provide inputs for improving design efficiencies site constrains, etc  9. Extend support in preparation of Commissioning method statements, day to day commissioning support to site team for executing CxA responsibilities.  10. Coordinate with project team on day-to-day basis for project interactions any systems clashes, or site constrains in terms of MEP Systems & rely the same back to design team for updating necessary design documentations.  11. Act as a point of contact for design support at site level & support & perform following  responsibilities:   a. Review technical submittals and provide comments as necessary on time.   b. Review & provide inputs for preparing & co-ordinating RCP layouts  c. Attend necessary design meetings with the client  d. Carryout necessary site visits for addressing any design / co-ordination issues.  e. Witness Testing & Commissioning of MEP systems.  f. Relay back any design issues to internal design team & get the same addressed as per project requirements.  g. Identify quality issues & prepare site quality reports & maintain a quality issue log.  h. Prepare & maintain all the records of Design & Development RFI & issue trackers as raised by any project members.  i. Check all the AS-BUILT & O&M documentations j. Prepare final list of Sign off on Project closure reports.

Qualifications:      1) Bachelors degree (B.Tech) or Diploma in Engineering or ITI certification in relevant disciplines.      2) Minimum of 1 year of experience for B.Tech graduates, 2-4 years of experience for Diploma/B.Tech candidates, or 5 years or more for ITI passouts.      3) Strong technical knowledge of MEP systems, fire safety systems, HVAC, electrical, and plumbing installations.      4) Proficiency in reading and interpreting technical drawings, blueprints, and schematics.      5) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively coordinate with various stakeholders.      6) Demonstrated leadership abilities and problem-solving skills. column2: This position involves working in the MEP (mechanical, electrical, plumbing fire) design and engineering team at XS CAD?? Global Delivery Centre at Andheri in Mumbai.     XS CAD?? MEP design and engineering team consists of skilled professionals, including mechanical, electrical and plumbing engineers with varied experience. This team delivers core building services design solutions to global MEP customers. XS CAD has delivered MEP services for hundreds of projects over the past 20 years, including hospitals, airports, stadia, educational institutes, commercial and residential buildings.     This position would require the candidate to work directly with leading MEP design consulting firms from Australia/USA/UK, who are involved in some of the flagship projects in their regions.         Key Skills       This job specifically involves the following key roles and responsibilities:       Overall design of plumbing. fire protection systems and deliverables, including concept design, schematic design, design development, tender design/documentation (including technical specifications, BOQ, schedules and drawings)     Designing complete distribution systems to current legislation and codes of practice for various types of buildings based on client briefs and guidelines     Working independently on various calculations and layouts/schematic mark-ups as per project requirements     Assisting the team to prepare plumbing and fire protection design documentation and calculation sheets     Helping draftsmen with plumbing fire protection design modelling using AutoCAD, Revit     Communicating regularly with clients and taking on design responsibilities for commercial, residential, retail, laboratories and hospitals     Understanding codes and standards local to project locations and utilising the latest leading industry software     Taking on a leadership role with the potential of growing a team reporting to them         Experience         Minimum 4-5 years??experience in designing plumbing and fire protection systems for commercial, retail, hospital and residential projects     Experience designing water supply, sewerage and drainage systems, including necessary calculations.     Experience designing comprehensive underground sewerage and storm water systems, sizing and selecting of locations for STP and water tanks, creating detail drawing layout for internal and external water and drainage systems     Experience in fire protection systems design of sprinklers, external and internal hydrant system, fire pump and tank systems design, hydraulic calculations     Experience working on AutoCAD to prepare design layouts     Experience using MS Office     Experience successfully managing client communication         Qualifications         Other Skills         This job also involves the following aspects:     Independently communicating with clients, stakeholders, leaders and peers in written and spoken English     Independently creating plumbing and fire protection design mark-ups and perform calculations     Training on and working on new design software     Displaying positive attitudes, such as flexibility, collaborative nature and empathy     Accepting and implementing constructive feedback       Any of the following criteria, while not necessary, would be considered an added advantage:       Skills in Hyena or Bluebeam         Experience working with international clients on international projects, specifically Australian projects     Knowledge of international codes NFPA, Uniform Plumbing Code, Australian standards     Exposure to sustainability-based design projectsBE/BTech degree or diploma in mechanical/civil engineering with relevant technical qualifications

column2: Company Description SOBHA Limited is one of the largest and only backward integrated real estate players in the country. With over three decades of experience creating stunning interiors in the Middle-East, Mr. PNC Menon founded SOBHA Developers in 1995 with a vision to revolutionize the real estate sector in India. The company is known for its benchmark quality, customer-centric approach, robust engineering, in-house research, ethical business practices, timeless values, and transparency. SOBHA is a preferred real estate brand in India and went public through its oversubscribed initial public offering in 2006. Role Description This is a full-time role for a BIM Lead. The BIM Lead will be responsible for overseeing and managing the day-to-day operations of the Building Information Modeling (BIM) team. This includes coordinating with project teams, creating BIM models, conducting clash detection, maintaining BIM standards, and providing technical support. The BIM Lead will be based in Bengaluru and will work on-site. Qualifications Proficiency in BIM software such as Revit, Navisworks, and AutoCAD Experience in creating BIM models, clash detection, and 4D simulations Knowledge of construction processes and industry standards Strong leadership and project management skills Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet deadlines A Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, or a related field Prior experience in the real estate or construction industry is a plus Responsible for BIM standards development, implementation & enforcement Creation & maintenance of the software template files to assure standards. Revit training to inhouse teams Assist on project works  modeling & details Help resolve BIM design issues Should be a Civil Engineer or Mechinical with 10+ years??of experience with minimum 5 years of experience on BIM MEP Must have in-depth knowledge of latest BIM versions

column2: Roles and Responsibilities     You shall work as a part of the project management team, reporting to the Project Manager/Incharge. You shall be responsible for all aspects of the project relating to building services.  You shall ensure that the day to day duties are performed professionally and expeditiously to support the ongoing progress of the project..  You shall review plans and specification according to the approved plan. You shall manage to oversee the work of subordinate staff contactor, and architects. You shall prepare plans, details, specified and cost estimated of plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning and general piping system. You shall analyze mechanical, electrical and plumbing engineering problem and formulate solutions. You shall identify problems in design, plan if any and report the same to the Project Manager.  You shall continually review the contractors construction schedule during the progress of site works with regards to MEP services and report to the project director on the same. You shall manage the day to day work of the MEP team. You shall undertake general project site observation/inspection of the mechanical services works for contractors adherence to the approved drawing and consultants specification, good working practices, and construction schedule. You shall monitor and promote health and safety on the site. Record and report any breaches to the project manager. If required stop the construction works if unsafe practices are being followed and report the same to Project Manager.   You shall attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meeting as directed by the Project Manager. You shall facilitate solutions to the problems as may arise between MEP subcontractors during construction. You shall validate design issues related to MEP and suggest alternative solutions. You shall direct, monitor and control the activities of MEP contractors such as HVAC, ELV, Electrical power and lighting fire fighting services plumbing. You shall be responsible for coordination and administration of MEP related materials, systems and shop drawings submittals. You shall ensure that MEP contractors adhere to project safety regulations. You shall assist in the testing and commissioning of MEP equipment. You shall manage day to day work with the MEP team.  You shall witness mechanical system final testing and commissioning.  You shall attend project, site progress and any mechanical services related technical meeting as directed by the Project Manager. You shall attend the Project Manager?? internal meetings. You shall set up meetings to resolve specific site problems as required to minimize delays in the progress of the project. You shall monitor quality of the contractor?? construction installations. You shall ensure that daily progress reports are produced with regards to MEP works. Any other duties which may be assigned; will be called upon to carry out any relevant activities, from time to time.
